website_summaries.verdict: Nice looking and easy to move, this is a great smoke-free and safe portable campfire option.
pros: Comes with a cover/carrier and a 10-foot hose for the propane tank
It's attractive, easy to set up, easy to light, and easy to move
A durable powder enamel coating keeps it looking nice, too
cons: It puts out a loud hiss that isn't as soothing as the crackling of a campfire and isn't as durable as some other brands

website_summaries.verdict: Take your campfire with you, with this portable fire pit specifically built for hitting the road.
pros: Safe to use during most campfire bans.Includes cover-carry kit, attached 10-foot hose with regulator, propane tank stabilizer ring, and decorative rock set
Stainless steel burner and fasteners with high-temperature powder coating
cons: Strap melts if the unit doesn't cool before strapping the lid back on

customer_reviews.title: Nice little campfire
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly with no damage. Set up in minutes and tested. I added ceramic logs on top of lava rocks that came with it to give it more of a real campfire look & feel. Once it heats up the rocks and logs radiate good heat. I also replaced the regulator hose with a 12’ quick connect hose ordered from Amazon so I can use propane directly from my motorcoach. Quick connect hose info:  Ceramic logs info:
customer_reviews.author: CO Diver

customer_reviews.title: Hot Spot
customer_reviews.text: Everyone at our house really likes this. We've used it almost daily for about a year. Super-easy to start and maintain. Burns off the chill on cool mornings, rainy days, or even in the winter. Mobile enough you can move it around the yard or even throw it in the trunk for road trips. Disclaimer on the attached video: it was shot the day I received the firebowl. You'll of course get blackening and grime build-up over time. (See attached pic.)
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great for other uses too!
customer_reviews.text: I really like the size and design. It fits well into my table as a drop in fire pit. Made some slight mods to the table and pit to make it sit in there, but it's now flush against the table top and has a nice cover to protect it from the elements during the winter months. Update - here we are barely 3 months later, hardly used, and the hose is defective. It leaks gas from the propane tank end. Need a replacement hose!
customer_reviews.author: Shopper#10M

customer_reviews.title: We love this fire pit
customer_reviews.text: We love this fire pit! We bought it for use with our motorhome and I changed out the hose with a 25 footer along with a quick connect to our large onboard propane tank. I couldn’t be happier. It puts out a lot of heat. Keep in mind, you can get about 6 people around this thing but that’s about it. We don’t need any more than that so it’s perfect for my wife and I.
customer_reviews.author: Traviscf

customer_reviews.title: QUICK-CONNECT to the RV propane tank with one additional item...
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE our new fire bowl for easy and efficient campfire ambiance and function! Like many others, we love a campfire while RV'ing and have found it so nice not to have to worry about avoiding smoke in the eyes, burn-bans, purchasing or hauling wood (with risk of the spread of pests). The fire bowl put out a fair amount of heat, keeping our legs toasty as we sat around and toasted marshmallows. After reading another reviewer's tip about purchasing the separate quick connect propane hose, we purchased the same hose and had success this weekend using the propane in our RV tank. This is the hose we purchased:
customer_reviews.author: Enid K.

customer_reviews.title: Consider something else!
customer_reviews.text: This thing doesn't have much of a flame, picture shows the best flame I can get, and can't feel heat unless you hold your hand over it. I've tried to contact the seller, but it seems impossible. I don't think I'm doing anything wrong since my other fire pit puts out good heat and a flame.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Where's the marshmallows?
customer_reviews.text: We camp often in state parks which do not allow you to have an open flame unless it is from propane. We love to have campfires at night, and this fits the bill nicely. This fire pit is the perfect size to fit in my trailer storage without taking up too much space and I love being able to dial in my flame size so I can stay warm, yet still stargaze. You can also blast it to get that campfire feel. Yes, we have even roasted marshmallows many times using this fire pit. We bought and carry an extra 5 gallon propane can just for this, and we can use it about three nights before I refill the tank.
customer_reviews.author: Sportsfaan

customer_reviews.title: Death Trap!!  Do Not Buy!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after seeing a friend's. It seemed really awesome. I finally just got around to trying mine... You have to turn the gas on and then light it with a lighter while standing over a fire pit! With my friend's, we did not have to do this. Imagine standing over an opan propane valve, with a match ready to be struck as the LP wafts all around your face and body... It is inherently unsafe and extremely dangerous. Any number of "hold my beer" YouTube videos come to mind!!
customer_reviews.author: MCinNH

customer_reviews.title: THERE IS NOTHING LIKE A GOOD SAFE CAMPFIRE ON A COOL NIGHT!
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased the deck safe Outland Firebowl 893 Deluxe Outdoor Portable Propane Gas Fire Pit with Cover & Carry Kit, 19-Inch Diameter 58,000 BTU of butt warming heat. Great for marshmallows & hotdogs and scary ghost stories. We love this because it's portable and will not harm our vinyl deck. It's also safe to use in parks that restrict wood fires during dry season fire bans. Bought on sale on Amazon for $80 bucks it's a great buy and well built for the money. Perfect for those suffering the coronavirus blues!
customer_reviews.author: Rev. Farley

customer_reviews.title: Nice build quality
customer_reviews.text: Nice build quality, handy to have on a cold camping trip where actual burning isn't allowed. Lighting and adjusting the flame is a little weird but TBH I didn't read the manual so that's me. So comfortable to sit around and enjoy but I do have to remember not to toss burnable garbage on it. Does use the propane but I used it pretty heavily (4-6 hours) per night and got 3 days out of a 20lb cylinder. I'd say operation was about $1 an hour. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: BiffTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Fire pit news for you
customer_reviews.text: Disliked that this fire pit does not have an igniter . Maybe not a big deal because most times they go out in time anyhow . Straps to carry the fire pit and cover are cheaply made . What we like , It seems like the controls are quality built being stainless steel , The fire pit is a tractive and it has a 10 foot hose connector to the propane tank. This way you can have a tank along way from the fire pit and hide it. We have only tried it once and the heat output is good. All in all we will keep this because the BTU is 58,000 , good output .
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Great Fire Pit
customer_reviews.text: Bought the unit to carry in our Motorhome to use at the campgrounds. It gives you the ambiance of a real fire without the clean up and having to watch the fire until it died out which many times was far past my bedtime. WIth the fire pit you turn it on and off and it cools down pretty quick so I can put it away in 15 minutes. When I am not traveling I use it on my back porch. I've made s'mores over the fire, used it for heat on a cool evening. Seems to last a long time on a 20 lb. propane tank.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Matteucci

customer_reviews.title: Work perfect for the application I wanted it for and it ...
customer_reviews.text: Work perfect for the application I wanted it for and it puts out a lot of heat. I have it on an enclosed outdoor patio at my mountain cabin and even in the cold weather, It provides just enough heat to take the morning and evening chill off. It comes with a standard 10 foot propane supply line with it, so I had another 10 foot made to make it 20 feet long to keep the propane bottle further away from the flame and family milling around it. The family loves it, thanks
customer_reviews.author: bobby

customer_reviews.title: Very well-engineered and safe
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product! It puts out quite a bit of heat and has nice flames to sit around. I bought it for my wooden deck, so I was concerned how much heat came out the bottom. I have felt the boards after a long session and there's virtually no heat buildup. I have a 5-gallon bucket of water and a hose nearby, but I doubt I'll ever need them. It has carry straps and a lid, so it will be easy to take it camping in July. I intend to, because the last two summers they've banned campfires due to the fire risk, but they still allow these. I'm very happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: G. Snapp

customer_reviews.title: It's all good (once you remove those unsightly warning stickers)!!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size and plenty of heat for intimate settings. Attractive, well constructed, and comes fully assembled. Just arrange the lava rocks around the burner and go. Plenty of lava rock included, don't buy more until you see for yourself. Warning! The ugly warning stickers around the base come off easily with no remaining marks or residue, leaving a sleek, understated appearance. I highly recommend you leave them on, however, so you can kneel down and read the squinty, inane warnings before operating! I'd write more, but my wife is waiting by the fire!
customer_reviews.author: Wrenfroe

customer_reviews.title: This has a big flame and keeps you warm
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup fired right up and looks awesome by the pool under the gazebo in the middle of the couches, long hose makes it possible to put behind the couch hidden, the flame is a nice size bigger than I thought it would be and puts out enough heat to keep you warm and toasty on a cool fall night, we even made Samores. Add fake logs and you can't tell it's gas after a few beers. No ashes flying in your face, and no one has to stoke the fire add wood. Best addition to the back yard ever besides the pool
customer_reviews.author: BarryDinSmoke

customer_reviews.title: Super Awesome! Super Portable
customer_reviews.text: Super Awesome! Super Portable! Super Nice! The fire pit is as advertised. The hose is ample length to hid the propane pit out of the way. This thing puts out a good amount of heat. The included lava rocks are nothing special- (functional though) so we replaced those with glass rocks and it looks amazing! Would totally recommend for camping or for a quite night on the patio with minimal setup but maximum ambiance!
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Real Nice
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. We went camping to a site that did not allow wood burning or coal burning and this was great. Put outs a lot of heat and was nice and easy to handle. Used a regular BBQ Tank and we got 4 days out of it running at low to medium flame for about 3 hours at a time. Will user it for other outings as well
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Nice product.
customer_reviews.text: Nice little fire pit. A couple things to note: it will use entire tank of propane in one night if you keep it on for many hours. Also there is a little metal ring that you are supposed to put under the propane tank to prevent it from sticking/freezing to the surface it is sitting on. We didn't read the instructions and left it on the pit and all the paint burned off it onto the lava rocks creating a sutty mess! Also the propane tank froze to our brand new deck leaving an ugly black ring on it. Don't do that.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Going strong 5 years later!
customer_reviews.text: Just went to order another one for a second location and Amazon reminded me that I ordered this 5 years ago. We've used it hundreds of times over the years and it's still going strong. Last year we had it hard piped to our house (served by propane) since the canisters went pretty quickly and it's a pain to refill them. This has made it super easy so we can sit by the fire almost every night. It's super portable to pack for a camping trip as well and ok to use during burn bans (check that for your area though). Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: L.B.

customer_reviews.title: Up’ed our camping game!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to take camping with us. It’s bulky and awkward... but totally worth it! It puts out a nice, controlled fire and no mess to clean up afterwards. We camp a LOT and are excited to make this one of the staples at our campsites. Sidenote: We packed up to leave one evening (it was dark and we’d had enough of the miserable campground) and we accidentally left behind the metal ring that holds the propane tank stable. Contacted the company and they sold us a new one, hassle free. Great customer service, from them. We’ll be buying the carry case for this, soon. Should make it more comfortable to carry.
customer_reviews.author: Haven

customer_reviews.title: Best Gift highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this as a gift. We met our friends for Christmas at the campground. We also bought a propane tank. The hose leaked. The best customer service person answered the phone and walked us through some potential reasons. It turned out the propane tank was the problem, not the unit. It is beautiful, burns warm but doesn’t heat the ground underneath. We love it so much we are buying ourselves one too. It’s great if there is no fire pit. I want to take it to the beach that way there is no smoldering wood left for anyone to step on. It’s very portable. I love everything about this.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: Serves its purpose!
customer_reviews.text: Advice: do not put ALL the rocks it comes with in it at first. Let it burn a few hours with just some of the rocks. When I loaded all the rocks at first I was highly disappointed at the amount of flame and heat it put out. The second night I removed some of the rock and although it still kind of smelled, the heat and light were much better!
customer_reviews.author: @HisNameIsSgt

customer_reviews.title: No complaints
customer_reviews.text: No complaints from me. I was concerned there wouldn't be enough heat output but surprisingly that was not an issue. I bought this unit for camping but decided to try it out before to make sure it worked. The pictures attached are with it set between the low and medium setting. We can still feel the heat output about 3 ft away (non windy day). Other than putting the lava rocks in, theres no assembly needed. Also, with the rocks in the unit its very light and the carry straps make it very easy to carry.
customer_reviews.author: lcaba123

customer_reviews.title: Best camping accessory ever
customer_reviews.text: We bought a tiny camper last fall. This propane fire pit works GREAT. We set it up INSIDE of our EZup Coleman screened in porch. It creates a cozy, outdoor space even in the winter. Due to fire warnings, we were not able to burn real wood as a campfire. No problem though, because we had our propane fire pit. Sets up easily, works great, creates a LOT of heat with NO ashes, NO embers, NO fire risk...so long as you don't have a wild elk stampede that accidentally turns it over or something.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli

customer_reviews.title: It’s important to open the gas supply VERY slowly to prevent the flow limiter from engaging.
customer_reviews.text: Received the Firebowl exactly as described. It came in it’s own packaging which is marginal for shipping - no damage. In spite of that, the unit and the two sizes of lava rocks assembled easily. It was a nice touch to have extra rocks included. The 10ft hose and regulator are good quality. The included directions are easy to follow and are comprehensive and should be read thoroughly. Pay attention to the adjustment knob as it requires to be pushed in slightly to turn the gas completely off. If you follow instructions, the flame has excellent adjustment. All in all we are very happy with this purchase and recommend the product.
customer_reviews.author: Osprey

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pit for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! I made a brick fire pit to put this inside of when I want to use propane for a quick fire. I’m easily able to take the gas pit out and have a wood fire. The carrying handle and cover are great and make it easy to move the pit around. Very well made and actually gives off a solid amount of heat. I built my pit lower to the ground to be able to feel the heat on the leafs and feet. I highly recommend this fire pit!!
customer_reviews.author: Phillip B

customer_reviews.title: Just what the doctor ordered!!!
customer_reviews.text: Being an apartment dweller this unit have me the piece of mine that I can safely have a fire. No random embers being scattered around. And the propane tank is stowed away with other patio supplies. For those that love to watch a fire with out the constant feeding a wood for fire, this is the unit for you. My first use was about a 7 hour burn. It used 1/4 of the 20 lb. tank. It has a cover that sits nicely on top. It's been though 40+ mph. Straightline winds. There aren't any fasteners to keep the cover on but it's lower stance I'm comfortable it won't blow off. I love this unit. You will too!!!
customer_reviews.author: New Purchase

customer_reviews.title: Best Gas fire pit ever!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this gas fire pit for camping with fire band... best investment ever. provides heat, you can cook on it - but don't cover the open area with sheet to block the flames. Must be grilling open surface to let the flames escape... Portable, no assembly required. I would recommend this item!
customer_reviews.author: Marcela Vlahova

customer_reviews.title: Really nice!
customer_reviews.text: We just received this and really like it. Our grandchildren love a fire when we camp but everyone wants to leave at the same time so someone has to stay until the fire is out. With this we can start it for a few minutes or a few hours and nobody has to watch it after it is shut down. It was very easy to assemble because everything was done except applying the rocks. Really great quality and value. Can't wait to try it out this weekend. Started it in the garage but not the same as a dark night telling scary stories.
customer_reviews.author: Linda J Wray

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Campfire
customer_reviews.text: I had read about others using this to enhance their camping experience and thought I'd try it out. We are very pleased! It provides nice ambiance and just the right amount of heat. We use it an hour or two in the evenings so it isn't consuming a lot of propane. It is easy to store in a bay of our motor home. Thus far I don't feel the need for the optional cover/case as the lid and strap work fine. Easy to set up as well.
customer_reviews.author: D. R. Stanley

customer_reviews.title: It is a perfect size, the flame adjusts from very small to ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to use at campgrounds that don't allow wood fires and we may just use it everytime! It is a perfect size, the flame adjusts from very small to quite high. This is great when camping in the summertime southern heat when you want a fire- (because really its just not camping without a fire) but its just to warm out. This was easy to set up, hooked right up to our camper propane, the cover and strap that come with it are very convenient. I am glad we bought this it will get used often.
customer_reviews.author: mommyandwife

customer_reviews.title: Open LP tank s-l-o-w-l-y
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect firepit - easy to store, portable and easy to set up. We RV travel a lot and enjoy a campfire most nights, but unfortunately there are lots of places where wood fires are banned or fire rings are not available. This is our answer to both issues...and we don't have to buy, carry or gather firewood along the way. This firepit hooks up to a standard 20-25lb LP tank, the same one we carry for our outdoor grill. Just be very careful to open the LP tank very slowly after connecting it to the firepit, or else some sort of vapor lock may occur.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri

customer_reviews.title: Cheat option and I love it
customer_reviews.text: I feel like I am cheating by using a propane firepit, however this firebowl from Outland works so well I do not care. No smoke smell, no prep, no cleanup, adjustable flame... I can step out in the evenings on my patio and have a fire for 10 mins, turn it off, and walk inside without worry. The supplied supply hose is long and with a bbq lighter will fire right up without an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M Funnell

customer_reviews.title: Outland gas firepit
customer_reviews.text: Great heat output on a cool night. Love its ease to setup and start. Flame output isn't bonfire high but decent enough. If close enough you can tell its a gas flame from the fumes as opposed to a flame from burning wood. It's not noxious but It's a trade off to not smelling like campfire afterwards. The few times I've used it and doesn't appear to be burning that much gas when using a mixture of high and low settings. I love the option of being portable.
customer_reviews.author: etelori

customer_reviews.title: It was great not smelling like smoke all the time
customer_reviews.text: I am impressed by the quality and functionality of this Fire Pit. We had the chance to use it this last weekend and I may never have a wood campfire again. It was great not smelling like smoke all the time. I have an enclosure room for my trailer awning and when it was raining all weekend at the coast of Washington we moved the fire pit inside and had our fire under cover out of the rain. I purchased some fire logs to add to it for an even better look. I seldom write reviews but I was compelled to for this, I love it! It stores easily in my outside storage compartment of my trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Jones

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for camping. Clean and easy to put away!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for camping and we LOVE it! Had some friends that gave me a hard time about not wanting a “real” fire, but then everyone ended up our site to hang No smoke was blowing in their eyes and ample heat for about 6 people to huddle around. Easy and clean to pack up too!!!! I have allergies and I hate bringing all that wood too. Great for camps that don’t allow wood burning fires too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Portable, powerful, warmth and ambiance
customer_reviews.text: The Outland firebowl is perfect for instant campfire fun. Sets up in minutes, packs a lot of heat, and creates an intimate outdoor theme. I recommend getting one for your backyard.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S

customer_reviews.title: Approved for fire ban, great for home and camping.
customer_reviews.text: Love this! We camp a lot and this is approved for places with a fire ban because it has a turn if switch. The fire looks great, as you can see from the pics the fire takes up the whole base without seeing the lines where the gas comes out. We also doubled ours for our patio at home we built a short round brick structure we can just drop it into for an awesome fire pit at home. It's also nice not to deal with smoke!
customer_reviews.author: Burtskirt

customer_reviews.title: A friend of mine had one and I liked the fact there was no smoke
customer_reviews.text: After years of wood burning - I have finally given in to buy a propane fire pit. A friend of mine had one and I liked the fact there was no smoke. These can be used when ever there is a camp fire ban (which seems to be happening more frequently), put out some nice even heat and literally can be used just about anywhere, rather than being subject to a fixed camp fire pit, which are many times located in an inconvenient place. The unit I bought feels sturdy, seems to be built very well and sturdy and I'm looking forward to using it.
customer_reviews.author: gunbear821

customer_reviews.title: This Thing is AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: This fire pit is great. We got a splitter and run this and the Blackstone off of it. So nice to get up in the cold morning and Whooof... instant heat and fire. We have used it to cook Hobo dinners etc. on. VERY useful in Arizona where they almost always have a fire ban during camping season. I see that unfortunately they are Not Available... probably all sold out to Arizonans ;-)
customer_reviews.author: WinU

customer_reviews.title: liked it so much we just purchased this one for ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this from another business a year ago, liked it so much we just purchased this one for a friend as a housewarming gift (same brand and model as our purchase). It is lightweight and travels well. The bowel stays cool so you can safely keep it on the deck. The lava rocks keep their heat. We took it on a camping trip this weekend and it was more economical and cleaner to use than a wood fire. No more smoke and the fire is instant. Estimate about 8 hours for one tank burning close to high setting, if you get the rocks hot and then turn the heat down a little, you could probably get 10 hrs. Love It.
customer_reviews.author: Monica Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Valve leaks
customer_reviews.text: We hooked it up to our propane tank and turned it on and we could hear and smell gas spewing out. The propane tank works fine with our grill. So the fire pit’s valve obviously arrived broken.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Unusable
customer_reviews.text: Used once before Covid 19 closed down camping. And nothing... can’t get it to light again with a brand new filled propane tank attached. Frustrating! And of course the return time expired when we can’t even go camping.
customer_reviews.author: IL

customer_reviews.title: Excellent alternative to carrying heavy wood!
customer_reviews.text: This fire pit is excellent! It has about a 6" flame OVER the top of the lava rock on high setting, and 3" on low. I found that the low setting was more than enough heat and ambient light for me on our last winter camping trip. The temperatures were about 35 degrees at night and we were warm sitting by the fire pit. I got about 10 hours of use from a full 5 gallon propane tank, however remember that instant heat/fire to instant off. One tank lasted us about 6 nights. I hope this review helps someone out there... It it a decent size, yet small enough to fit easily in my Pop Up camper! Love this product!
customer_reviews.author: SpencerTeri

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, could be better
customer_reviews.text: We love our new little instant Firebowl, but we aware. It's a propane product, you will hear a "hissing" sound even on the LOW flame setting. I went to the propane tank and slowly closed the valve until the fire started to die out. Now we have a low burning flame without the annoying hissing. Just wish the manufacture could of built this feature into the product. The fire at this low setting still puts out plenty of heat and ambiance.
customer_reviews.author: Scott S.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice.
customer_reviews.text: Update- I love it now. Just needed to warm up a bit First impressions when it was super cold- Maybe I’m doing it wrong but this thing could NEVER keep me warm in the winter as other people posted. I’ll see when the nights get more mild but the idea that this replaces a fire pit is a joke. I have to practically stand on top of it. I will change my review if the rocks heat up and provide more ambience and heat but I’m just not super happy with it right now.
customer_reviews.author: AmazingUser1234

customer_reviews.title: Fire Hazard
customer_reviews.text: We tried out this product for the first time last night. As my husband was adjusting the dial, flames engulfed the entire dial and singed all the hair off of his hand! And now I am past the return date. This was a big waste of money and a fire hazard!!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly K Vestal

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality!
customer_reviews.text: Ok, just got this fired up last night for socially distant happy hour in the driveway. My buddies wife, and mine, were so happy with this fire pit. Very nice finish and control knob. It looks as nice as the photos on amazon. The fire rocks are very nice and there is no noise at all from the burner. The rocks look like a real fire and kicks out plenty of heat. You need this if you have a patio or deck and want to extend your outside time. Happy wife! Take this opportunity to make yourself look like a genius!
customer_reviews.author: william fels

customer_reviews.title: Awesome gas fire pit!
customer_reviews.text: This fire pit exceeded expectations! Set up was a breeze-basically lift out of the box, arrange the rocks and go. Connected easily to a standard propane tank. The hose is plenty long to keep the tank out of site, and the pit even comes with a stabilizing ring to set the tank in. Lit immediately with a gas lighter. I am pleasantly surprised by the size and heat output of this fire pit, and my cat enjoyed the box! I purchased the Deluxe model with a lid and carrying straps. Completely portable. Highly recommended for those who want the ease of a gas pit with minimal effort (like me!).
customer_reviews.author: LP

customer_reviews.title: Get rid of the wood ... get this!
customer_reviews.text: We have had fire pits for years, but decided we didn't want to deal with the smoke and firewood storage anymore for the two of us, so we bought the Outland Firebowl. We use it on our screened in patio and love it! Easy to light ... burns clean ... no smoke and really a nice heat output! We also went ahead and bought the Outland Propane tank cover and table top and would recommend it as well!
customer_reviews.author: Nola Keith

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t really produce heat but accomplishes a campfire feel. ...
customer_reviews.text: I primarily bought this because of constant fire restrictions in Colorado. Unless fire restrictions jump up to a stage 4, this is legal in most areas. I removed the stock hose and put a quick connect fittings on BOTH the hose and the firepit so I can run it off the camper or a 20# tank.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I am a full time Rv’r. I didn’t think we would like this thing because I like a real wood campfire. Turns out this is one of the best things I’ve bought for the Rv! We can use it most anywhere, even where campfires aren’t allowed in most cases. It’s much cheaper and definitely more convenient than firewood. And We can sit close to it for heat without getting smoked out. Really very happy with this 😊
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Great for camping.
customer_reviews.text: With not being allowed to have camp fires in our mountains the last two years, I had to get this and it’s a great alternative. Only thing I didn’t realize, it doesn’t have the click start on the knob like my buddy had on his. You have to use a lighter or match to start it. But I still give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Michael G.

customer_reviews.title: Camp Fire without the smoke and smoke smell
customer_reviews.text: The main reason for getting this fire pit was my daughter can't be around wood smoke. Great for camping! You don't go to bed smelling like camp fire. First time we used this Outland Firebowl 893 Deluxe we camped will three other campers in a circle. Everyone thought it was great. Yes we did the marshmallow and what nots. Going to use it for Halloween as a Lord of Light. 5 stars no regrets on this purchase. Comes with lava rocks added fire glass at a later date.
customer_reviews.author: Bad Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: The portable gas fire pit seems to be well made and is a nice size for portability but we haven't had a chance to use it yet. It was a Christmas gift for my husband and we plan to use it on our camping trips which don't begin until April. We usually have 8-14 people at our camp-outs so the size of this fire pit will be perfect for us and no more worry about leaving smoldering logs. This seems like a good value monetarily and we look forward to many years of enjoyment with it.
customer_reviews.author: NanaSharon41

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT. You will not be disappointed in this item.
customer_reviews.text: We love this. We love, love, love it. And our parents loved it so much, and talked so much good stuff about it, that we bought them one. Will buy again if it ever breaks. Be sure to get the one with the lid and carry handle and, if you can, get the one with the more complex burner configuration, not just the square. That's what we'll upgrade to when we can find an excuse to do it.
customer_reviews.author: WINSLOW

customer_reviews.title: Best little fire bowl to light up the evening!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, gives off the right amount of heat for the chilly spring evenings. Fun to gather around and a bit mesmerizing. We typically bring it indoors when it rains; however, with the cover it could easily be left outside. Super pleased and have recommended to friends. You’ll want one!!
customer_reviews.author: C. Brodeur

customer_reviews.title: Great fire pit, terrific customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fire pit for our patio. We did convert to natural gas with the manufacturer recommended adaptation. Terrific customer service as we did notice hissing sound when running. They explained that different gas services have different pressure delivery and this may be the cause of the hissing. It is not very noticeable now. We are extremely happy with this pit. Yes, we have roasted hot dogs and marshmallows perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Gaylene M Charles

customer_reviews.title: Nice fire for any occasion
customer_reviews.text: Need a fire? No problem. Turn it on and enjoy your evening, no matter the weather. This is a great product and looks nice anywhere you need to gather around - at home or on the road. The lid clips on with elastic straps that are very sturdy, along with a handle. We leave it outside for convenience. Have used this same product on a rafting trip while camping with a group during fire season (restricted areas allow these since there are no sparks.) Check you local areas for safety rules.
customer_reviews.author: Ski Patrol

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing, great item, works well and puts out a lot of heat for its size.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't know what to expect but when I set it up and started it for the first time was very impressed with the heat output for the size (19 inches diameter). The portability is great, took it to a friends lake house and used it on his composite desk. Seems that all the heat goes up and very little heat is on the deck material. Once the rocks get hot it puts out a pretty nice hear to the point where I need to back up a little. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: kay jacobson

customer_reviews.title: She loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Since it's finally getting cooler and we haven't been able to build a wood fire pit, I ordered this for the deck and it's excellent, plus we can take it with us as we please! Highly recommend, untested on marshmallows. Also watch your eyebrows when lighting.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob E

customer_reviews.title: Take this out camping!
customer_reviews.text: We use this fire bowl while out camping in the forest cause of fire restrictions in our area (no wood burning). It's relatively small, but puts a good amount of heat. Comes with lava rocks to simulate coal fire. Smores aren't the same cause this uses propane, but it's a great substitute nonetheless.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Break out the firepit
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use on a condo balcony or in the city or even if you want it when camping. Doesn't burn through propane fast, comes with its own regulator and looks great. Has a carrying strap that allows you to put the lid on and easily pick the pit up with and pack it in the back of the truck. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Best Purchase!!
customer_reviews.text: OUTSTANDING purchase!! Researched this for a while. Wife has asthma and can't handle the smoke from a campfire. Decided to purchase this unit, along with a 12 ft quick connect hose. Simply removed the hose that came with it, screwed on the quick connect hose and BAM, instant campfire!! Light weight with carrying strap makes it easy to transport. Fits in the back compartment of our camper. Outside, Football, chili, camper lights, and a campfire we can all sit around and not deal with everyone and everything smelling like smoke. So happy with this purchase!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Nice propane pit
customer_reviews.text: Okay I put my review on the pit storage bag which I’ve yet to use. Great small propane pit. It works great on our deck. Doesn’t get hot on the bottom but puts out lots of heat with the lava rocks. Easy to set up and use. The supply is adequately log. I got the propane bottle cover which is well designed and cover the ugly white bottle
customer_reviews.author: Bill Mansfield

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Use this when camping, so many places are under burn bans. Will allow gas fire rings. Stores in our RV lightweight and puts out good heat. It's very light and self contained. We added a bayonet style gas line to use our bottles on our camper. Very well made and survived over 8,000 miles of travel. Highly recommend and no more buying or hauling wood.
customer_reviews.author: GP

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! We travel for work in our RV and this will enable us to have a fire when ever our hearts desire. Comes assembled. Its bigger than I thought...and that's perfect! Make sure when you get ready to light to turn it on and off switch. Then slowly open the propane ...this ensures a steady build up of gas for the flux compasitor . then turn on and light....otherwise you will get a small flame. Its awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Ann M. Junkins

customer_reviews.title: GREAT QUALITY PRODUCT! LOOKS LIKE A REAL CAMPFIRE!
customer_reviews.text: WE use this portable campfire for warmth , cooking and just the romance of a fire in general, WITH OUT THE SMOKE! I am a smoke magnet! no matter were I move, the smoke finds me, and I smell like a burnt log ever after! With this thing there is no smoke or smell....so if your boondocking, and water is at a premium, this product will help you conserve water and not be ''MR stinky campfire''!
customer_reviews.author: jeff alsop

customer_reviews.title: Awesome firepit
customer_reviews.text: I like how easy it is to use and it is portable. We use it for camping instead of a wood fire due to the hazard and a big plus is you don’t get that smoke blowing in your face and go to bed smelling like campfire. It’s fun and easy to light up for the kids to roast marshmallows in the backyard. We get a lot of use out of ours. It’s worth every penny
customer_reviews.author: William K.

customer_reviews.title: Great firebowl produces lots of heat
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this so we could sit outside in Casa Grande, AZ once the sun went down and it really works. I had a new cable made so I could connect the firebowl directly to our RV’s LP tank. Our daughter also purchased one for use on there potio so the grandkids can roast marshmallows
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Life saver for camp fire restrictions!
customer_reviews.text: We camp aaaall the time and our nightly campfire is always the best part of the day. Well, when CA started enforcing fire restrictions, camp fires weren't allowed EXCEPT by propane. We bought this for a trip we took our rookie friends on, knowing how key the camp fire was, and it worked great. It gave of a surprising amount of heat and was super easy to transport and pack up. It *does* go through quite a bit of propane so make sure you have enough for whatever purpose it's serving.
customer_reviews.author: k9alison

customer_reviews.title: High Quality
customer_reviews.text: I often move the firepit between two locations and found it is very portable. I did purchase the bag and recommend it for better portability. The firepit gives off great heat and have only used it on the lowest setting, which appears to be plenty for my needs. I am pleased with the purchase and a neighbor is buying one too!
customer_reviews.author: K. Chumley

customer_reviews.title: Awesome firepit!  Easy to transport and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: We bought this firepit due to the fact that wood fires are basically banned throughout Colorado this summer (for good reason). Have this firepit was the highlight of our recent camping trip! So easy to transport and to use. I love the cover and included strap that keeps the hose and cover on tight while making it easy to move in and out of the car. Great design, and excellent heat output.
customer_reviews.author: AML

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Great Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: When I got the package, I set the fire pit up following the instructions and it worked great. I noticed I didn’t get the carry straps & tank ring thought, so called customer service and got a friendly Canadian gal to help me resolve the issue with a warranty form. Filled it out, and a week later they sent the items. Nice to know they have great support should you have any issues. We love having a nice little fire without the hassle and smoke now!
customer_reviews.author: Leah Neesley

customer_reviews.title: The Fire pit you want!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I researched what propane fire pit to purchase for the backyard patio and discovered that Target would advertise the round Threshold brand model but every time we called or tried to order they were out! We then discovered the Outland Firebowl Deluxe 890! Wow this puts out heat like a wood fire pit! Easy to set up and get started, the flame was robust and easy to adjust. I do recommend that you use one of those long handled trigger lighters! All guests were impressed with the smokeless fire pit and we feel it was the perfect solution! Best of Luck!
customer_reviews.author: Archtop

customer_reviews.title: awesome pit.
customer_reviews.text: Great outdoor firepit. Great size and hose length. Well built. Lava rock is light and perfect size to cover the flame tube. No igniter. A match will do or lighter. Shipping was a day early. Light enough to carry with the equipped strap. That's a big plus
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Great Heat For Deck
customer_reviews.text: We wanted something simple and easy for heat on our deck and this is exactly what we need. Took my husband minutes to put together. Takes a few minutes for the rocks to heat up but once they do it’s a good amount of heat. Hose to gas is definitely long enough to hide away. Would recommend to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Smoke free campfire
customer_reviews.text: We have a few people in our camping club that cannot take the smoke from a wood fire. This is one reason I bought it, the second is I can have a fire for an hour and shut it off for two hours and then have a fire again for an hour and shut it off and go to bed. Cannot do that with a wood fire very easily. That said, I still like a real fire when time and circumstance allow. I bought a carry bag after, different brand, but it fits well. Only thing I'd like to have is a built in igniter. Have to use a BBQ Lighter with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jim N

customer_reviews.title: Great flame in windy conditions
customer_reviews.text: We have a very windy backyard since we are on a hill, but this little unit has great heat output and the flame never falters. Super happy! The kids are excited for our "fire pit" and we don't have to bother with the lingering smell of fire wood. We love this thing!
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking and no mess!
customer_reviews.text: This was a great investment for us being on the road in a campground! Quick and easy, just put in rocks and hook up propane! Though it hasn’t really broke off cold yet, on the chillier nights, this has been great for movie nights with our projector. It looks good too!
customer_reviews.author: Amber Raines

customer_reviews.title: No cons just warm flame
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a hit, I use it for camping, and this little guy puts off a good flame. What I like about it most is I can run on med/high for a total of about 20 hours on one tank. This beats packing in, or scrounging for firewood. Keeps the weight down in my truck when going camping. Eventually it will pay for itself when considering the extra fuel for my truck I don’t use hauling firewood into the campgrounds.
customer_reviews.author: JarrodH

customer_reviews.title: Firebowl is a great patio campfire
customer_reviews.text: We have used it much more often than I expected. Great for smores. Gives off plenty of heat. Light weight, quick setup. stores cleanly. Here is the negative. Uses quite a bit of propane every use. The lowest setting is still very high(in my opinion). I calculate about 4-5 uses per standard propane tank. That is 50-90 minutes each use on the lowest setting.
customer_reviews.author: Finchie

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice but no striker?
customer_reviews.text: Nice propane fire pit. Plan on taking it camping instead of toting heavy fire wood with me. The only thing i wish it had was an auto striker as you turned the gas on, or just a striker in general. Holding a lighter in there while the gas is going is just asking for hairs to be singed
customer_reviews.author: Tyler A

customer_reviews.title: Instant heat
customer_reviews.text: Everything was just as expected. Right from delivery to setup no issues. You will be able to roast the hot dogs and make the smores in safety over this little unit and enjoy a warm camp fire without the sparks or the mess.
customer_reviews.author: jeff

customer_reviews.title: Perfect addition for campers or for the deck at home.
customer_reviews.text: Portability, quality and performance make this fire pit what I consider the best on the market. I would suggest buying the optional carrying case for ease in traveling if you are a camper. Quality materials throughout. I would highly recommend this Outland Fire Pit!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly McGinnis

customer_reviews.title: Made Well, Good Size Flame and Shipped Quickly
customer_reviews.text: We like to camp often but, sometimes we can't have wood fires in the forest or at RV Parks, so we bought to have as an alternative. Unit works well and has a good size flame compared to others I have seen/used. We are very happy with this product so far.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: too much gas!  LOL
customer_reviews.text: great little fire pit, and fairly easy to transport for camping; however, I was surprised at how much propane the fire pit used. In just 2 evening, we used an entire 5 gallon tank of ! this could end up being pretty costly.
customer_reviews.author: yadayada

customer_reviews.title: Great fire pit!
customer_reviews.text: Camping ⛺️ we couldn’t have fires 🔥 But we got this okayed by the forest service! It doesn’t spark, its really warm. We placed it on gavel. Can roast marshmallows or hotdogs! They only down side is it uses a lot of propane!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for places that have wood burning bans.
customer_reviews.text: With fire bans all across our state I was left with 2 options. Either don't go camping with everyone else or try this out. Sitting up late around a campfire while camping is what makes camping enjoyable for me. Laughing and creating memories. This fire pit had accomplished that. It gave enough light and heat for us to enjoy the stars and share some laughs.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Gilmore

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!!!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for those campsites that dont allow wood fires or when theres a general fire ban. I haven had a chance to use it while camping but I've gone thru 2 20lb propane tanks in the back yard and this thing ROCKS!! I'm in love with this little fire place. Gotta go get more propane for tomorrow night!
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Great ulternative to smoke.
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I both had pulmonary embolisms. As much as we love a camp fire we can't handle the smoke. This is a great ulternative. We've used it in the back yard and taken it camping and it did pretty well. I wouldn't sugjest it as a cold weather heat source though. It doesn't have a big enough flame or put out enough heat. One standard sized propane tank will last you about 2 full days.
customer_reviews.author: Eskimozie

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely LOVE our fire bowl! My husband was skeptical about the assembly and how much heat it would produce. He was pleasantly surprised and happy I purchased the item! It was very easy to assemble, quick to start, and prettier to look at than expected. Make sure you don’t get too close when lighting it! We took a family camping trip this spring and the weather turned colder than was predicted. This little fire bowl helped keep us warm and comfortable. So happy we bought it and we plan to use it frequently!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fire bowl saves camping trip.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Does what it says, and it gets quit warm. And the included lid/handle are worth the extra few dollars over the other exact same model that does not include the carrying kit. We camped where fires were restricted due to dry conditions, so this was great to have at night and in the morning. Camping in the cold dark is no fun, so buy a fire bowl just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Corey Weidner

customer_reviews.title: So worth it
customer_reviews.text: This thing rocks we went to the beach on the west coast very cold at night there where about 10 bonfires we got to our spot and set up in about 5 min with heat a source and visibility and chairs it was the best beach late night experience that all 12 of us had in a while
customer_reviews.author: J-mizzle

customer_reviews.title: Best L’il Fire Pit Ever
customer_reviews.text: Best little fire pit ever! We keep this on our trailer most of the time to take with us camping, but also use it in our front yard during Christmas time to keep warm while we enjoy our lights and our neighbors coming by, with a cup of hot cocoa. It’s so easy to move, simple to use and worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Asher

customer_reviews.title: Great for Camping
customer_reviews.text: Love this little guy. In California, there is high fire danger when camping. Wood fires are prohibited, but propane is ok. This is quick to light, no mess, quick to turn off. No waiting for the logs to burn down then douse with water, etc. The firebowl is sturdy and well built. I changed out the gas line that came with it for a quick connect 18 foot gas line that connects with my RV.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Just the right size, plenty of heat.
customer_reviews.text: A friend has the larger size but difference between 19" and 23" is hard to tell. This one puts out the same amount of heat and takes up slightly less room. Ignitor might have been a nice feature.
customer_reviews.author: Jim    Nolley

customer_reviews.title: Good solution where you cant burn a wood firepit
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little firepit. Its not the ultimate heat source, especially if its windy. I enjoy this more for the ambient camp fire atmosphere and is useful at parks that dont allow you to burn wood fires. The one thing that bothered me most is for the price they could have put an igniter on it. Dont forget to keep a lighter handy!
customer_reviews.author: Jaret

customer_reviews.title: love this
customer_reviews.text: during a time just before Washington State was on fire (literally) , a burn ban was already in affect , so i bought this portable fire pit , and it was loved by everyone camping with us (about 12 people) cooked hot dogs and smores , it kept us warm and provided some light ! , my daughter and her husband loved it so much , I gave it to them as 1 of their wedding gifts, along with a 30lb propane tank , we camped for 5 days , used the 30lb tank and still had propane when we left , and we ran it a lot ! :)
customer_reviews.author: Don

product_meta.title: Outland Firebowl 893 Deluxe Outdoor Portable Propane Gas Fire Pit with Cover & Carry Kit, 19-Inch Diameter 58,000 BTU
product_meta.description: Perfect for outdoor recreation, the Outland Firebowl Deluxe adds ambiance to any outdoor activity and offers the easy alternative to traditional labour intensive campfires. This 19" diameter certified fire pit is safe to use during most campfire bans, you can bring the warmth and experience of a cozy campfire with you anywhere outdoors. Our 58,000 BTU fire bowls are constructed from high quality steel with a protective powder coating and enamel finish for long lasting durability. Features of the Outland Firebowl Deluxe include stainless steel burner & fasteners, chrome knob with rubber comfort-grip, and a 1 year Manufacturer’s Limited Warranty on all products. Outland Living is committed to consumer safety and satisfaction; all of our propane fire pits are CSA approved. Selecting a fire pit with an accredited certification ensures not only your safety has been considered but also the design and manufacturing standards have been approved through independent expert testing. In most instances burning a propane fire pit without CSA or UL certification during a burn ban is prohibited. Sit back and relax knowing that your Outland Firebowl Deluxe accurately performs at the 58,000 BTU output advertised while exceeding safety standards. The Outland Firebowl Deluxe uses a standard 20 lb (5 gallon) propane tank (not included) and burns clean and smokeless, giving off enough heat to enjoy with family and friends anywhere outdoors. NEW CSA approved Natural Gas Conversion Kit 780 and Outland Carry Bag 760 now available separately!
feature_bullets: ✓ PERFECT NO MESS CAMPFIRE: Say goodbye to dirty ash, expensive firewood, and bothersome smoke and enjoy a clean realistic propane campfire. The perfect outdoor centerpiece for camping trips, RV travels, tailgating get-togethers, beach parties, and family evenings on the backyard patio.

✓ COMPACT AND EASY TO TRANSPORT: Travel size fire pit is lightweight and portable; easily set up in minutes with no tools required. All weather fire bowl delivers a clean and smokeless flame with cozy warmth and beautiful evening ambiance. Measures L 19” x W 19” x H 11” with total output of 58,000 BTU/HR. Max Gas Supply Pressure: 250 PSI

✓ BEAT THE CAMPFIRE BAN: CSA approved fire pit is safe to use during most campfire bans; always check with the current fire restrictions in your area. Spark free propane campfire helps protect campgrounds and forested areas with a safer easy-to-use fire option.

✓ COMPLETE FIRE PIT KIT: Includes Cover & Carry Kit, pre-attached 10-Ft hose to keep your standard 20-Lb propane tank cylinder (not included) safely out of sight, fully adjustable regulator with chrome valve knob for varying flame height, and 4.4-Lb natural lava rock set designed to enhance flickering effect. Optional accessories of CSA approved Natural Gas Conversion Kit 780 and Standard Carry Bag 760 available separately.

✓ SIGNATURE OUTLAND LIVING QUALITY: Durable high quality steel construction with protective enamel finish for dependable longevity; superior stainless steel burner and fasteners. Outland Living has outdoor living perfected so you can create the perfect ambiance to share stories and good times. Make new memories with family and friends, in comfort and style anywhere outdoors, with the Outland Firebowl Deluxe propane fire pit. Ignition Type:Manual

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars2,668 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
